examples: he wrote to her, informing her of the situation
they were informed that no risk was involved
the role of television is to inform and entertain

verb.description: Give an essential or formative principle or quality to.
examples: the relationship of the citizen to the state is informed by the democratic ideal

origin: Middle English enforme, informe give form or shape to, also form the mind of, teach, from Old French enfourmer, from Latin informare shape, fashion, describe, from in- into + forma a form.
